However, I discerned that my own composure could influence theirs. Initially, I sat down and instructed them to calm down, but they resisted. Upon repeating my directive, they grew somewhat quieter. I realized that by ignoring their antics or remaining patient, they would eventually settle, as their primary objective was to attract my attention. This strategy proved effective; they became significantly calmer, a behavioral improvement that persisted during my subsequent babysitting engagement.

"Pull harder on the reins!" my instructor yelled. "I am trying, but he is not responding!" This had to be the most obstinate horse I had ever ridden. He acted entirely according to his own will, completely disregarding my commands. "Alright, please bring him in," she said. I gradually guided the horse toward the center of the arena. "I am genuinely attempting to control him, but he refuses to listen," I explained. "I understand he can be strong-willed, but I assigned him to you because I believe you can manage him," she replied. The horse's name was Rusty; he possessed a reddish-brown coat and large, liquid brown eyes. His appearance suggested a compliant and noble steed. In reality, he was neither amiable nor obedient! "Now, walk him around the perimeter several times," my instructor directed. "Very well," I responded. As we reached the midway point, Rusty halted abruptly. He then turned right, approached a window, and began licking the beads of water condensed upon the glass. "What is he doing now!" she shouted. "It appears he is licking the water from the windows," I stated. "Lead him away immediately; he could become ill!" As mentioned, this horse possessed abysmal listening skills, and I was consequently reprimanded for his behavior. "You must be patient," she advised. Recognizing the need to compose myself, I relaxed slightly and resumed riding without further incident. The experience demonstrated that I required greater patience and a calmer disposition. Nevertheless, I remain resolved never to mount that particular horse again.

Patience manifests in various forms throughout life. Primarily, it can yield rewards upon fulfillment; greater patience often corresponds to more significant outcomes. Additionally, it allows one to engage in other productive activities during the interim. For instance, while awaiting an event, you could accomplish other tasks, making the eventual attainment more merited. Furthermore, while patience can be challenging, maintaining composure enables its management. Many individuals struggle to wait, preferring to rush through processes. Finally, having exercised patience successfully once, subsequent instances become considerably easier as one grows more accustomed to the state of calm endurance. That constitutes my personal interpretation of patience.

Occasionally, when a process seems interminable, I might quietly express frustration, yet I consistently demonstrate patience at school and in restaurants. I strive to be patient everywhere, though there are moments when I struggle and cannot maintain it.
